results.title: Mr Ikegami's Flight
results.brief_description: Mr. Ikegami (Kazuhiro Muroyama) is sent to Australia from Japan on business. His task is to locate the boss’s wife whose gone missing. Speaking no English and confined mostly to his hotel room, Mr. Ikegami realises the futility of his search and longs to be back home with his expectant wife.

results.title: Mr Horatio Knibbles (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Mr Horatio Knibbles is a magic rabbit that only Mary Bunting can see, Mary’s mother’s jewellery goes missing but with the help of Mr. Knibbles and his friends, Squirrel Postman, Air Mail Pigeon and Mrs. Magpie, the real culprit is found. A live action fantasy. Rated: G.

results.title: Mr Horatio Knibbles
results.creator_credit: Anvil Films, Hugh Stewart and Robert Hird
results.brief_description: Mr. Horatio Knibbles is a magic rabbit that only Mary Bunting can see. Mary’s mother’s jewellery goes missing but with the help of Mr. Knibbles and his friends, Squirrel Postman, Air Mail Pigeon and Mrs. Magpie, the real culprit is found. A live action fantasy. Cast includes Anthony Shepard as Horatio Knibbles, Lesley Roach, Gary Smith, Rachel Brennock, John Ash, Nigel Chivers. From an original story by Wallace Bosco.

results.title: Mr Holland's opus (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Interscope communications, PolyGram Film International, Ted Field, Michael Nolin, Robert W. Cort and Stephen Herek
results.brief_description: Richard Dreyfuss plays Glen Holland, a musician who falls into a temporary teaching position at J.F. Kennedy High and stays for 30 years. The opus he composes takes second place to his great work, that of enriching the lives of his students as they pass through his class. This is not a film about a hero who performs brave deeds; but of ordinary people in everyday settings who strive daily for excellence in their lives. Dreyfuss is ably supported by Glenne Headly, Jay Thomas and Olympia Dukakis. “Mr Holland’s opus” is a sentimental, warm film which will uplift the spirit.

results.title: Mr Gimme
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America, Dolores Danska and Peter Mark Schifter
results.brief_description: The story of a boy who has his heart set on drums but can’t afford to buy them. Tony’s determination to get his drums leads him into a “get rich quick” scheme selling greeting cards. The troubles he causes his family teach him a painful lesson as he realises he must take a steady job as a delivery boy and repay his debts.

results.title: Mr Frog went a-courting
results.brief_description: An old Scottish song story richly illustrated by film animator Evelyn Lambart and sung by Derek Lamb to lute accompaniment. The story is about a handsome frog who courts and wins a mouse for his bride. The colourful animation does full justice to the events that take place during and after the wedding breakfast. (Award: New York.)

results.title: Mr Fixit - my dad
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Timothy Read and Michael Thornhill
results.brief_description: A film to provoke discussion. With his son facing a drug charge from smoking marijuana, a father is faced with a dilemma: should he let events take their course or should he attempt to get his son off the hook? Cast: James Condon, Jessica Noad, Tony O’Malley Jones. Cinematography by Russell Boyd. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Mr Europe and the common market
results.creator_credit: Columbia Broadcasting System, Carousel Films and William K McClure
results.brief_description: Summarises the economic changes in Western Europe today. Shows the costly difficulties encountered by a truckload of goods from Manchester, England, before it arrives at its destination in Italy. Shows how the common market breaks down barriers, and benefits participating countries. Interviews Jean Monnet, “Mr Europe” and other businessmen involved in the common market.

results.title: Mr Chairman: fundamentals of parliamentary law
results.brief_description: Presents the fundamentals of parliamentary law in a series of dramatic animated sequences. Shows why rules of order are essential to the processes of democratic discussion and decision-making, and suggests ways in which parliamentary procedures can be adapted to the specific needs of a group, whatever its size or objective.

results.title: Mr Blandings builds his dream house
results.creator_credit: RKO Radio Pictures, Norman Panama, Melvin Frank and H C Potter
results.brief_description: A farcical comedy starring Cary Grant as Jim Blandings, an advertising man with two precocious daughters and a loving wife (Myrna Loy). Frustrated by their cramped and chaotic New York apartment, the Blandings purchase a property in Connecticut, hoping to relocate their family to an idyllic country estate. When their vision of peace and tranquility is shattered by the news that the house should be demolished, they embark on a expensive and highly charged journey to build a new home. Narrated by their pessimistic lawyer-friend (Melvyn Douglas) who anticipates problems and consistently advises the couple against their extravagant dream. Screenplay by Norman Panama and Melvin Frank, based on the novel by Eric Hodgins. Cinematography by James Wong Howe.
